topic: here’s what’s happening now with mortgage rates after trump's latest push on housing affordability

text: Mortgage rates are plummeting after former President Trump's latest push on housing affordability
The average 30-year fixed mortgage rate has dropped to 6.2 percent
The Trump administration's efforts to boost housing affordability have been ongoing
Regulatory barriers are being reduced to increase access to affordable housing options
The Federal Reserve has announced plans to keep interest rates low
Many experts predict a surge in home sales and refinancing activity
It's still unclear how long these low mortgage rates will last
The current trend in mortgage rates may not be sustainable in the long term
Many factors can influence the housing market
Only time will tell if this is a permanent shift or just a temporary reprieve
Homebuyers are waiting to see if this is the break they've been waiting for
The housing market is complex and subject to change
Experts are watching the situation closely to see what happens next
The future of the housing market remains uncertain
